Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucypayne03
Reviews.Content: I recently visited The Gran Ronda Hotel on a school trip to which I found that it was great value for money. The hotel was situated in a great location, only 5-10 minute walk to Las Ramblas or the nearest metro. The hotel its self was very clean, modern and offered good facilities. The beds were comfortable and the room offered air-conditioning or heating. Our first impressions were that it was really nice however we found the receptionist to be a little rude, never the less we were able to check in early which allowed us to go straight out and explore the City. I would visit the hotel again and recommend anyone who is looking for a hotel with a great location. The hotel is most suitable for those wanting a short stay as the metro runs underneath the hotel till late at night which distrubes sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Barry J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, 200meters from Metro, 10minute walk from La Rambla and food markets, there's a small supermarket behind the hotel if you want to get some nibbles or stuff for lunch. If you are staying here try and stay on the 4th ot 5th floor because Metro goes underneath but don't let this turn you off if you cant. Overall we had a great weekend with no complaints about the hotel. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!very good location!!”
Reviews.Author: gfmari
Reviews.Content: very good location near the center and las ramblas!we had a triple room which was a little small but it didn't bother us..also big and nice bathroom!it was clean and the staff was helpful.We had no problem with the noise although we had a room facing the street.Considering the amount of money we gave the hotel was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Flairman
Reviews.Content: Excellent location , small rooms but very clean ideal reasonably priced hotel if you plan to spend all day out sightseeing. Staff were excellent and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location but try and stay on a higher floor.”
Reviews.Author: JON72
Reviews.Content: My Fiancé and I stayed at the Hotel Gran Ronda in mid March. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Universitat metro station and within 5-10 minutes walk of Las Ramblas, so it's in a great central location. We stayed on the second floor in a double room. The room was quite compact but clean. It was also located at the rear, so was quiet. That was until a metro train went by underneath! As others have said, try and stay on a higher floor if possible to avoid that noise problem. We didn't eat breakfast at hotel so cannot comment on the quality. There are however, plenty of bakery's and restaurants nearby and quite reasonably priced to. All in all I would recommend the Hotel Gran Ronda for it's location alone, but also for it's reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrynnaV
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Gran Ronda for 3 nights recently - it was a surprise for my boyfriend... I'd looked into lots and lots of hotels and finally decided on this one. Great location - very central for walking and metro 2 minutes up the road. The rooms are a decent size for being in the middle of a bustling city (don't expect them to be huge!). We had a room at the back of the hotel on a higher floor - we could not hear the street noise. The rooms were cleaned daily. The breakfast was good, kept us going for hours! The staff are friendly and helpful. This is not a 5 star hotel but ideal for a city break where you are not going to spend most of your time in the room. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for young travelers”
Reviews.Author: SalahK_12
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Gran Ronda hotel for 3 nights (6/3/2012 - 9/3/2012) , we stayed in the first floor with window facing the street . the hotel was very clean and every day they clean the room as we left , the beds are fine , the staff was great , they help us a lot with a problem i faced and answer every question and guide us to near super market and restaurants , the location was great walk distance from plaza Catalonia the center of Barcelona and it is near L2 , L1 metro station .The neighborhood was safe quit at night. the breakfast is really basic but good . on the other hand the i guess the hotel is bad for light sleeper , like me , although there is double glass window that reduce the sound , but you would feel and hear the metro underneath you and hear the night buses stops at the traffic light so it is better to get rooms in the 4th or 5th floor. but overall it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated within easy walking distance of the City Centre. It is clean and the staff are helpful and polite. The rooms are good, clean, and functional. The only downside is that the hotel is situated right over the Metro and the trains can be heard and felt throughout the night. That being said we slept well and have no complaints. Would recommend the breakfast option. Lots to choose from and all fresh. Coffee was very good and fresh. We would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lisa26186
Reviews.Content: My mum and i arrived in Barcelona from Venice. After taking the AEROBUS to Placa Universitat we found the hotel within 5 minutes walking distance. You would miss the entrance to the hotel if you are not looking. The Hotel staff were pleasant. The hotel is modern and clean. Our room was on the 1st floor and we had a balcony. If you leave the balocny door open the streets are very noisy but if kept closed you can hardly hear the noise on the streets. You can feel the building shake when the train goes under the hotel. I dint find this overly annoying. Rooms were clean and had more space than i had anticipated. The hotel is slightly out of the tourist area and would not wander this area at night. During the day is fine. It is about a 10-15minute walk to La Rambla but a metro stop is right on the corner. We used to metro to get everywhere in Barcelona. Breakfast was very good. You could only enter the hotel after hrs via magnetic card which i found reassuring. not overly priced and 3 start all round. I would stay at the hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at the Gran Ronda Hotel, BCN”
Reviews.Author: Dana182
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the gran ronda hotel in barcelona, on september 2011. We stayed on the 5th floor, facing the back of the hotel (not the street). The location was very good (close to public transportation and by foot to all the main attractions), in a quiet and clean area. There were about 3 supermarkets very close and many cute cafes. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The price was a bit high for a 3 star hotel, but given the fact that it was during La Merce festival and most of the hotels were fully booked, I must say I was very satisfied. We didn't have breakfast included so I can't comment on the subject.

Reviews.Title: “All round we were happy enough and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MacPlumb
Reviews.Content: Location was acceptably close to the key site seeing locations eg main tourist bus start points, Las Ramblas, Catalunya Square, and restaurants. Room was fairly spacious, simple and uncluttered, with a good quality bathroom. Tiny balcony on to the street which was noisy however the double glazing did a good job of suppressing this. University Metro stop is about 100m, the noise from the metro could be heard and it appears to run all night but not enough to keep us awake. The buffet breakfast was good although the supply of food lagged behind the demand at peak times. Responses to requests for help from reception staff varied from very good to totally disinterested when I asked for help to confirm and to chase up a late minibus pick-up.

Reviews.Title: “Plain, not very helpful hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: marleneqm
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a plain, nothing special, bland hotel-Gran Ronda is fine. But if you want something more then just a bed, look elsewhere. First we arrived at 10am before any other guests and we told to return by 2pm. We returned by 1:30 and we were last of all those guests waiting to get our room because it had not been cleaned. Once we got to our room, the bathroom was still dirty with hair in the shower and sink and the sink was clogged. The staff is nice, but not very helpful when it comes to finding anything from places to eat, how to get to popular tourist spots, or even how to get to the airport by metro. Most times there reply to most questions was "I don't know". The area is no far from main areas, but it isn't in not the best area after dark, be on your toes walking home. If you are a savvy traveler and don't mind a boring hotel, and have your own plan of attack for your stay, this ill work just fine for the price, but if you are looking for a little extra when you get back from your long day of sight seeing and may occasionally want some assistance on where to go and how to get there, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Regular but centric”
Reviews.Author: Muhaddib
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Central but not on the buisiess streets. Close enough to Plaza Catalunia to walk there. Been here a few times. Will recomend if in buisiness.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate price”
Reviews.Author: tyoma
Reviews.Content: Good location, adequate price We stayed 1 night on beginning of June. The price was 75 EUR for twin-bed room. The hotel is located close (3 min walk) to metro station Universitat. Famous Rambla Boulevard is 10-15 min walking form the hotel. Another Barcelona's “blockbuster” – Casa Ballo is also located not far from the hotel – about 20 min walking. Direct airport bus – “AeroBus” (6,5 EUR) has stop 3 blocks from the hotel. So we found location as very convenient for walking tours over center of the city. The hotel itself is clean, has small lobby and 2 elevators. We had the room with windows to the street (exactly that room with flags above the entrance) – if you open the window it is quite noisy, hard to get asleep. The room itself is small and a bit used, “tired” as we say. But the bathroom quite was clean. I don’t know why – but we haven’t been asked either we need non-smoker room or smoker one. As we don’t smoke we found our room a bit stinky of cigarette smoke. As a good bonus - free hi-speed WiFi was available in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SWusan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overpriced and uncomfortable. Spartan room, broken shower, uncomfortable beds, noisy from street and subway. Rooms were smoking rooms, even though non-smoking rooms were requested. Even worse were the neighboring guests who parited between rooms until 5:30am. Calls to the desk went unanswered. Front desk staff was not empowered to make any decisions - or they chose not to. We moved to a much nicer hotel - The Grand Hotel Central - with great rooms, beautiful roof-top bar and pool, and delightful staff. It was less money, a better location, and a much nicer hotel. Althought the breakfast and the breakfast staff was lovely, it absolutely was not worth it! Find yourself another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boshardt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights during our stay in Barcelona. The hotel is slightly out of the main tourist area – it is about a 12 minute easy walk from Las Ramblas. There is a subway station about 100m from the hotel. When we got to our room we discovered that there was water dripping from the ceiling in the bathroom. We spoke to the receptionist who offered us 2 other rooms which were both about half the size of the room we currently had. As he promised that the problem would be fixed the next day (it was fixed) we opted to stay in our room. Our room was fairly spacious with a desk and chair and a side table for luggage. The reception staffs were friendly and helpful in providing information about the city. We did not have any problem with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PaulHutton_Macdonald
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on a Monday evening, and the hotel was full. The room I was checked into resembled nothing on their site and was an internal room with a small window overlooking the atrium which runs from the lobby right up to the top floor. The hotel's site makes this out to be a remarkable feature; it isn't, and it only serves to carry the noise of the slightest movement in the lobby right into your room. This coupled with a lot of movement outside my room and a hard bed meant that I didn't sleep much before 6am. And that's not to mention the noise from the Metro passing underneath the hotel - a real boneshaker! I was on a room only rate and when I complained in the morning, the manager on duty did oblige and offer us a complimentary breakfast which wasn't bad for a 3* property. I was also assigned a non-smoking room as I failed to specify what I wanted on their booking engine - there is a section for this which I missed so partly my mistake. The room stank, but the guy on the front desk did his best to help by getting some air freshener for me. The whole of the first floor is smoking so avoid this floor if you're a non-smoker. The location is good for Raval and l'Eixample, and the staff were pretty friendly but I wouldn't personally book here again. I noted that whilst I paid just over 100EUR for the room, over Easter weekend they were charging nearly 300EUR for a standard room - this is outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, very hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Exu
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel. I had a standard room, very small with actually no window. The location is ok, the staff friendly but I had to move after the first night because the bed was so hard that it was just like sleeping on the floor. There's also some noice and vibration coming from the tube going under.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: alleshha
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights at this hotel and was a great choice! The hotel is very central, with shops, cafes on the corner, la rambla and the bouqueria market and lot of places are walking distance from the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms were very nice and clean and we also enjoyed the balcony in our room. I strongly recommend and would choose it again when in barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location, Wonderful staff, Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SivanMer
Reviews.Content: We (my 2 friends & i) stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from 21 nov till 25 nov 2010. Excellent Hotel & staff. Realy good location - 3 min walk from plaza catalonia and max 10 min walk from la rambla. Very clean hotel and rooms. The hotel`s staff was wounderful, kind and very helpfull. The rooms are very small and there are no mirrors except `lil mirror in the bathroom. The breakfast was excellent and varied. Good value. Sometimes you fill a lil bit of trembles because of the metro trains but its barely sensed. We enjoyed our stay very much. I definitely will come back to the hotel and recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: cocovlc
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget place and managed to get a room at the amazing rate of 61 € per night (stayed 2 nights) in this hotel, which was EXCELLENT value given the location and the quality. It was from the "economy" range with just a window looking over the inside patio (not outside), rather small and dark but clean and comfortable. Location is very central and ideal to walk around the center. Overall the hotel looks new, with a nice modern deco. Friendly & helpful staff too. Will probably go back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: nutters001
Reviews.Content: After a poor start to our holiday with a Laterooms.com booking into the wrong hotel, we were offered this hotel. What a gem, we arrived stressed upset and extremely disapointed after being in Barcelona for 3 hours. The staff were helpful giving us a room at the back of the hotel. Our room was clean, with air conditioning, towels and shampoo etc. The staff give us advise on travelling around the city and suitable security when we were out and about. We would recommend the bar around the corner on the square for coffee, and drinks. You certainly get a birds eye view of the city sights!!! This hotel is walking distance of The Ramblas, the tourist buses and the Gaudi houses. Thank you for showing us the light after a awfu lstart to our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good place”
Reviews.Author: Uuno_turhapuro
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, good service, good breakfast. Modern style with some wearing marks on the furnitures. Silent room at the backyard. Close to the metro station University. Negative was that the beds were single beds so we had problems to keep them together and avoid falling on the floor. Ventilation was not the very best one but you could always open the window to the peacefull backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LeaAthens
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the front side, looking on to a main road, and this was preferable to the the other side. The room was clean, nicely decorated, and beds were comfortable. The hotel has several levels, we were on the 5th. The breakfast room was below ground level, leaving lots to be desired in term of a view of an ykind or actual sunlight. There was sufficent variety offered, although it took them long to refill the omelet dish, and I had to go without eggs on two days (waited for 15 minutes). The staff was very polite and helpful, and there was also a security guard. The location was great, only a ten minute walk to the La Rambla. There was free internet connection all over the hotel. At night you could only enter the hotel with a magnetic hotel card. I also saw a three bed room and found that room to be quite cramped (same size as the two bed room) and the third bed was a cot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was spot on”
Reviews.Author: UtopiaNorthWales
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with helpful friendly staff. Breakfast was very enjoyable each morning in a clean modern breakfast room. Hotel was well positioned for travelling into the city.No problems to report at all.Would not hesitate to book again.Three star rating all round.Reception staff in particular were very helpful with providing maps and directions to local attractions.Weather as always was just great.Second visit to Barcelona and just as much fun as the first time.Barcelona is the complete package whatever your taste.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1976
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern. Rooms were nice and clean looking with a minibar and tv. Big spacious bathroom. Staff were friendly but felt a bit stiff. Great value for money with that central location near Eixample, and Pl Catalunya. Breakfast for 11 euros felt a bit over the top. Overall a bit better than we expected, it was after all one of the chepest hotels we found in that area. We had a great stay and would come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindRuss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Gran Ronda with a friend for two nights / three days during a July 2010 trip to Barcelona. We payed approximately US$350 for both nights for a room with two twin beds. This hotel is best described as average, or mediocre. It has a vaguely modern but very heavily-used feel to it. We were assigned a room on the second floor and took the stairs each time, as the elevator was terribly slow. Our room was tiny, with a window that looked out onto the unpleasant backyards of low-rent apartment buildings and unfinished construction sites. The bathroom was good size, but the shower was so tiny that I bumped into the door or wall with almost every move. A very noisy tour group moved onto our hallway on the second night, and made a huge racket with kids running between rooms and adults yelling which was, of course, wonderful... We took the Aerobus in from the Barcelona Airport, and had a very difficult time finding this hotel. The hotel is simply not well marked, with barely any visible signage from the sidewalk. Upon finding it -- finally! -- we encountered a line at the check-in desk and a very flustered staff person who spoke only broken English. It took about 30 minutes to get our room key -- so annoying. Hotel Gran Ronda is located in a quiet, non-descript, non-touristy neighborhood about a ten-minute walk from Las Ramblas and right near the University. It is also on the same block as a subway stop, which was convenient as we took the subway a few times to get to different sights around Barcelona. The location is somewhat random, and also gets a bit sketchy at night with homeless people hanging out near the university, and alleyways that we were told to avoid after dark. The hotel has a computer station available for guest usage for free which I appreciated. There is also an Internet cafe around the corner where 1 Euro buys you an hour of computer time. Breakfast is not included with the hotel. My sense is that hotels in Barcelona are pretty pricey. Given that, the Hotel Gran Ronda is not a bad choice. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it, but I also wouldn't not recommend it. Ultimately it was just... fine.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: IsraelMichal
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Grand Ronda hotel. The room was clean and quiet, breakfast buffet was good, and the stuff was very nice and helpfull. The location is good and neiborhood pleasant..

Reviews.Title: “Godd location, clean room, helpful staff but a bit expensive 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fussy-Honest9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights & the title I gave above for this review of this hotel describes everything some one wants to know about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of LastMinutes secret hotel”
Reviews.Author: babe-storm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a "top secret hotel" on the last minute website. The Hotel was clean the staff were helpful, (apart from one one on a night shift), it was in a good location. However because we booked via the "top secret" route we appear to have got rooms that the hotel are actually ashamed of. We paid a bargain price, but for that we got rooms that rather than a city view had a lovely view of the lift shaft. If the air conditioning had not been turned off because it was "winter" unfortunately it was very hot as the room had no natural air movement. As such the "window" had to be left open which then meant it was very loud. I am sure that the other rooms are lovely, but check that you have an actual outside window before booking.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: leftwingback
Reviews.Content: what a pleasant surprise this was! this hotel is perfect, given the price we'd paid for 2 nights' stay. our double room was spacious, clean and modern, as was the bathroom. our street facing room offered plenty of light, but it was by no means noisy if you shut the door to the balcony. staff were attentive and helpful (on check-in, the girl at reception almost begged me to be careful about pickpockets). location-wise this was great too. just on the outskirt of what's considered central barcelona, it's about 10 minutes walk from la rambla, placa de catalunya and the old city. great if you want to stay away from the hustle bustle of the tourist areas. there is also a bus outside the hotel that can take you to parc guell. all every convenient

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, convenient, quiet”
Reviews.Author: klynstra
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely designed modern hotel with comfortable rooms. My room was quiet, though i requested a room away from the street, which they were happy to provide. I don't know how noisy a room on the street would have been. It's not a very busy street, but it's not a side street either and I suspect there may be "people noise" more than traffic noise. I think this is a very good hotel for a single person or an adult couple, but perhaps not for children -- largely because the neighborhood seems more adult-oriented and possibly less safe than other parts of Eixample. Note, however, that I am confident the hotel itself is very safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Mediocre Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JacquieW
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located midway between two Metro Stations on two different lines and within easy walking distance of La Ramblas. There are multiple cafes and places to eat around. As such the location is excellent. However, we were given a room with no external window and therefore no natural light or air. The only window overlooked the lift and (five stories down) the lobby. This made for what can only be described as a cave like experience. The room was roasting hot and stuffy and very noisy with even the bed creaking every time we rolled over. The first night we were there my husband actually slept on the floor in an effort to stop the creaking of the bed and let me get some sleep! We picked the hotel for the location and the price, being a little off the main tourist areas meant a great reduction in cost. There are however a number of other hotels in the same area and, as such, I would book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: enigma475
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Gran Ronda for three nights. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. There is a mini refrigerator in the room which is very helpful. The hotel is located about 7-10 minutes walk from La Rambla. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jembalou
Reviews.Content: This was a clean and comfortable hotel. It was everything you would expect from a 3 star hotel. he staff were friendly and welcoming, happy to help and advise you on your stay in Barcelona. The rooms were cleaned everyday to a high standard. VERY close to placa de catalunya (the top of La Rambla). On check out your suitcases can be left in a safe secure place until you need to leave for the airport etc. Would DEFINATLEY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More IKEA than designer”
Reviews.Author: peba
Reviews.Content: The Gran Ronda is an ok hotel, but the location is stellar. Lots of restaurants nearby, metro station 2 blocks away and close enough to the old town and the rambla to walk back to the hotel after a long day. The shower was very slow, 2-3 minutes for warm water, the sound proofing was not too great, but nothing major. I'd definately stay in the neighborhood and possibly the hotel if I were to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “location & shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: krenmartz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The place is up-to-date and very clean. The room size is fairly big for a European hotel. The Bathroom is clean. The place is quiet. There is a free internet. The hotel is about 2 blocks away from a metro. Arriving from the hotel, take the airport bus that stops right in front of the departure doors. This airport bus drops you right at Placa de Catalunya. From there you can either take the metro (1 stop from there - stop San antoni) or walk. It's a bit of a walk but beats the human traffic at the metro. the bus is much much less complicated than the metro to get to the hotel. It will also, save you some money. The bus only cost 4 euros. You would need to take 2 different trains from the airport which i think it cost us 6-7 euros. The hotel is within walking distance to La Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya. May take a bout 5-10 mins walk. Along the way, you will find a lot of shopping stores and places to eat. Overall, it was a great stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again! Cozy!!”
Reviews.Author: Sumuffin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and has great staff. Very nice rooms. Good price. The only crappy part about it was there are prostitutes outside across the street... they dont bother couples but singles walking down the street! If you decide to rent bikes make sure you BRING them to your room or have the hotel watch them... we got ours stolen. Its not the best part of town but it still isnt in the bad part of town, its just a small walk from La Rambla which is the main street! Other then that it was a great hotel/1

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, in good location”
Reviews.Author: lpma40
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel in a good location, central to everything in the city. Rooms basic but adequate. We found it noisy at night due to other noisy guests, and the traffic outside (despite being on fifth floor). Lots of emergency vehicles passing by with sirens going at all hours of the night. Breakfast was an extra 11 euro's per person, so we went out to local cafes as this was a much cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: JMHF
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonably priced hotel which was within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter and stumbled on the Gran Ronda. The hotel is a very pleasant 5-10 minute walk from both of these and is seconds from the nearest Metro station, which is dead easy to use for all the main sights. We had a twin and a double room on the 5th floor, both with balcony doors opening onto the main street. The rooms were a good size and bathrooms large. Everything was clean. Yes the beds are hard, as we'd read in the reviews, but we like that! We'd read about the noise from the metro underneath and yes you can hear it rumble but it wasn't enough to wake you / keep you awake at night. The staff on reception were extremely helpful whenever we approached them. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel and can't say we even noticed the bar / restaurant areas so can't comment. All in all a great hotel in a great location. We stayed for one night and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very So-So”
Reviews.Author: caseypops10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel gran ronda for 3 nights, we had asked our travel agent to call hotel and ask for early check in as we were coming straight off a cruise ship, she was told by guy on phone as long as we have empty rooms not a problem, night before we were meant to arrive we checked internet and yes rooms available. Next morning we were up at 6am off ship by 9 in hotel by 9.30am-ish, went to desk got told room wouldnt be ready till 2pm! Said ok but asked for a room to the front with balcony said fine that would be ok. went back to hotel 1.50pm room still not ready said havent you got anything, he said we can get another room ready in 20 mins or so! but it isnt a front room and wont have a balcony. What they had been doing in past 4 and a bit hours is still a mystery!! By this time we were exhausted and said fine whatever. Room was small, smaller than our balcony cabin on ship. we had a big patio door/window which looked out onto a junk tip. That night we went to front desk and a nice guy called sebastian recommended a lovely paella place at port olympic which was really great. he definately was the best of the front desk people. the other 2 we encountered were very much blah about everything. Our next encounter with them was our next to last night our flight wasnt till 9pm we asked for late check out, was told check out was 12 noon and if we wanted to stay even 2 hours later be a full day of 70 odd euros. We declined. Check out day they stored our luggage for us and we could use lobby facilities. Hotel is handy for metro and placa cataluyna there is a small spar shop opposite way from placa cataluyna. Port olympic is a must visit as is sagrida famillia, We did the tour bus red and blue routes and went to the nou camp which is on red route bus stops right outside front door.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBeth
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with this hotel and recommend that you find another place to stay. To be fair and balanced, here are the positives: The room and bathroom were an adequate size. The bathroom had a full tub and shower. There is a refrigerator in the room, and free wireless internet. The location is good with access to the Metro train and walking distance to La Rambla. The room is very clean. Breakfast is served in the hotel (for an additional charge). We didn't eat breakfast here, but our travel companions did and thought it was good. Ok, now the negatives: The only room they had available was a room without windows. When we expressed displeasure, the answer was pretty much "too bad" (and we heard that tone of response a lot). Without a window, the fact tha the air conditioner did not work was a problem. We complained about it all 3 days, and while they said they sent repairmen, it never did work properly (the hallway was always cooler). The mattresses are very firm. They mistakenly gave us a wake-up call that we didn't order (our first morning when we were jetlagged and needed our sleep). Slow sink drain. No facial tissues. Laundry is outrageously priced - 8-euros for pants, almost 5-euros for undergarments (for laundry, dry cleaning was more). We asked the front desk what the phone charges were for local and toll-free calls, and they didn't know (couldn't they look that info up somewhere?). The issues overall were minor, but taken together, and along with a truly indifferent/borderline rude front desk made for a below-average experience. There are tons of hotels -- I'd just go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but beware noise of the tube etc”
Reviews.Author: travelle18
Reviews.Content: Just back from a second trip to Barcelona and stayed at the Gran Ronda, only 5-10 mins from the Ramblas. The first room we were given was VERY dark and small. It was an interior room so had no outside window. We asked to be moved which was no problem. The second room was fine but had clearly been done on a low budget...the shower was very rusty, the mini bar door was hanging off, leaking sink etc (given this is described as a 'new hotel' we were disappointed) but we had a safe in the room and a balcony looking on to the road which was good. The staff were helpful and there is free internet access available which is useful if you need to print tickets etc. I wouldn't book this hotel again as although the location was good (only 5-10 mins to the ramblas etc), it was VERY noisy with the tube running beneath the hotel, noise from the reception and from other rooms travelling through the thin walls and loads of banging doors. There was a lot of noise from the outside road but we did ask for a window so you can't have everything. Overall: VERY Noisy (especially the tube beneath the hotel), a bit shabby but friendly staff and good location and not too expensive...but I've stayed in better hotels in Barcelona for much less!

Reviews.Title: “grat location- rooms are a bit small”
Reviews.Author: zeynepsan
Reviews.Content: great location. great staff& service and nice breakfast with good coffee. the rooms are a little too small for my liking!

Reviews.Title: “Good no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanKent
Reviews.Content: This is a good no frills hotel. Couldn't really fault the hotel for what it was. There was no restaurant or bar, but the amenities they had were good, clean and fit for purpose, The reception staff were all very polite and helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance from La Ramblas. If you want a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of the city, this one fits the bill. There are obviously hotels on La Ramblas but you will pay a lot more. We travel to a lot of cities, and always get a hotel centrally based, to be near the main tourist attractions, this also saves on cab fares. Even though we usually stay in higher grade hotels, we left it late to book and couldn't get the usual rate we look for with a higher grade. We were pleasantly surprised with the Gran Ronda Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_Becky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through LastMinute.com and were really pleased with it. It's in a very central location, 2 mins from Universitat metro and 10 mins to Placa de Catalunya / Las Ramblas. The hotel is basic but modern with wooden floors, wooden furniture and neutral colours. Bathroom was a good size with a very nice shower. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Overall, if you're looking for a cheap, cheerful and central place to stay, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: MargaretAtlanta
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean 3 star hotel with helpful, friendly staff conveniently located close to the Universitat metro train station. We spent 5 nights here in March - room/hotel is very quiet. Had a nice balcony onto the street. They also have a computer with internet access in the lobby for guest's use. 10 minute walk to La Ramblas and 3 minute walk to Catalunya Plaza. The price is very good and would definitely book this hotel if I plan another vacation in Barcelona. Had breakfast one day for 11 euro and it was good but maybe not worth $18.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, firm bedsThe hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoroSnowy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot on a main road just a few hundred yards from Universitat metro station and a ten minute walk from Placa Catalunya and the top of La Ramblas. We booked two rooms each for two adults only a few days before our stay and got a good deal of around 90 euros per room which for a three-star is not bad going (don't believe what you see on the web about it being a four-star - it's not!). The guy on reception when we arrived on Saturday evening was very friendly and polite and spoke excellent English and the reception area was smart and modern. Although when booking we'd asked for rooms on the front of the building with windows overlooking the street, one was actually by the lift overlooking the foyer so for any kind of privacy you would have to close the curtains and we were concerned about the noise. But we asked to change and they were happy to switch us to a room with a street view. The hotel looks like it has recently been refurbished and the rooms are very modern - all dark wood and painted walls - and uncluttered, with decent-sized bathrooms (with constant hot water and a power shower), air con/heating, and small, flat screen TVs. Noise from the street did filter in as the windows didn't shut tightly enough but there are shutters and heavy curtains which help minimise it and after a long day sight-seeing it didn't stop us getting to sleep! Breakfast wasn't included and I think it is quite expensive if you pay for it there seperately but we found a nice place at the top of La Ramblas which served english and spanish breakfasts. The room was cleaned to a good standard but quite late in the day - it was getting done when we returned from sight-seeing at around 4.30pm - and the staff we came across were friendly. We didn't need much advice from reception about where to go and how to get there but they were approachable and always available. The street was bustling on the Saturday night when we arrived but Sunday's seem to be quite a dead day in the area - there are lots of electronics shops - but even when it was quiet it felt as safe as you could expect for a big city, although a short-cut through El Raval from La Ramblas isn't advised at night if you're not in a group. The only real gripe about the rooms would be that the matresses are quite hard and the amount of bedding you get isn't enough for February. All in all I'd recommend this hotel for a 1-3 night stay but if you were staying for longer, a four-star with a bit space and facilities like a gym or pool might be better, or perhaps even an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: ZKDDS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Ronda for 3 nights during our stay in Barcelona. We paid 120 euros a night, and it was worth every penny. Our rooms were very modern, with a beautiful bathroom and flat screen tv. The hotel is situated north of Placa Catalunya in the business district, and it was very close to the Universidad Metro station. We could easily walk everywhere, although we did enjoy taking the speedy train as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “great location and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: JoBurgers
Reviews.Content: I found the Gran Ronda hotel to be a lovely well located hotel in Barcelona...5 mins walk to Las Ramblas and 1 min walk to the nearest metro where you can access almost anywhere in the city... We requested a double room the morning we arrived as the website we booked on would not allow us to and we were accommodated..the room was facing out on to the street..there was no smell of drains or no noise..except the cleanin lady knocking at our door..but we did sleep in late!! The staff were helpful,especiallythe lady who checked us in..we didnt get breakfast as i thought it was a little pricy,but ate out instead.. all in all a lovely stay in the Gran Ronda :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: croesoicymru
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my Boyfriend in Jan 2007. As soon as we checked in we were impressed, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was one of the best we have stayed in! Flat screen tv, huge bed, modern bathroom and the whole room decorated to a high standered. We also had a small balcony over looking the front of the building. The location of the hotel was great, we were right in between 2 metro stops and used this form of transport to get around every day, it has a systym very similar to the London underground and we found it very cheap. You could also easilly walk to most of the attractions as the Hotel is in a very central position. We just wish we had been able to stay longer as Barcelona is a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bit far from the beach”
Reviews.Author: muffinshanks
Reviews.Content: Booked on lastminute for a hotel plus filght deal. Finding the hotel was no problem, just take the aerobus from the airport, the big blue bus, which takes you all the way to placa catalunya and stops at various places. Get off at placa universitat which is the penultimate stop and walk down the road st. antoni. its about 2mins walk on your right. Its not the busiest of roads and the hotel is next to some electronics shop. We arrived pretty late and were mildly annoyed at having to stay in a double bed rather than a twin room as booked, as we were two guys. The hotel staff were helpful in moving our bags to the adjacent room which had twin beds in the morning. Morning buffet breakfast is fine and held in a smallish room in the basement. There appeared to be a mixture of tourist nationalities, with i think one hen party whilst i stayed, but they were the civilized type, in the daytime anyway. Finding Las Ranblas is pretty simple as its 5mins walk away, but the beach is a rather longer walk of 20mins due to having to wlk around the harbour. We decided on a principle of walking a different route everyday and we found that walking south through El Raval is generally NOT a good idea if you're female and on your own. We stumbled upon the prostitute street at 11am!!! which was a nice wake up call. If heading to the harbour and the beach, go via Las Ramblas. There are two metro stations very nearby and you should buy the T10 pass which gives you 10 trips. More than enough for a week's holiday. The rooms were decent sized, clean with a nice tv. There can be no complaints on the hotel, and there's free internet in the reception. The room has a safety deposit box, a safe baggage store and the staff were friendly all round. Though on checkout, there was some confusion over the breakfast and mini-bar bills, but this was sorted out without fuss. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone travelling solo or group if it appeals. There was no problem with noise, and if you want a balcony, ask for a street-facing room. Great view. I have no photos as my computer harddrive decided to die on me over the summer, but the website photos are pretty genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Shame about the city”
Reviews.Author: legend76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Ronda for one night in early November 2007. I have to say an absolutely fantastic hotel. Rooms are very modern with superb bathroom facilities and flat screen tv. The room also has a mini safe which comes in handy. The staff are also very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The downsides are that the street outside the hotel is very sleazy at night. Don't let this put you off as many streets in Barcelona are like this. Watch out for the lowlife pickpockets, especially on the metro. Keep an eye on your bag/wallet at all times and you will be ok. I was only in Barcelona 6 hours and my wallet was stolen from my pocket despite only having my hand out my pocket for all of 30 seconds on the metro. All in all, great Hotel, its a shame my experience of Barcelona in general has deterred me from visiting ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: missvoyages
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Gran Ronda 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. I asked a room with an external window and a double bed (French bed) and our choice was respected. The room and bathroom were large and tmodern and the bed was very confortable. Staff was very nice too and gave us a good map of Barcelona with directions. But the must about this hotel is the location. It was close enough to the Plaça de Catalunya (10 minutes walking) and at the same time, far away enough so you don't have to pay ridiculous prices for a sandwich. Avoid having any lunch or dinner at the Ramblas as it is so expensive. We had a coffee and a croissant for 1.50 € near the hotel! I recommand this hotel for its value too, while checking on the internet, we found that some hostels or pensions were charging the same price for much less comfortable rooms All in all, we had a very pleasant stay at Gran Ronda

Reviews.Title: “Gran Ronda Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dimac
Reviews.Content: The Gran Ronda is well placed, it 's on a road that runs parallel to La Rambla. You can walk to the North end off La Rambla via a well lit side street within 10 mins. The breakfasts are superb with a wide choice of both continental and English style food. The rooms are well appointed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sadandy
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located. Metro station was 2 minutes walk away. Rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. Breakfast at 11 euros was not included in the room rate and was overpriced for the buffet. No bar or other public rooms. There was free internet access at a computer in the lobby. There was noise all three nights we were there from drunks coming in all at all hours till 4.00 am which kept us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Opportunists”
Reviews.Author: AGRJ
Reviews.Content: For the reference of maps and without the real knowledge of the localization, we made the reserve in this hotel for one night(attencion: the interested does not have the notion of badly night on the street, dark and very dangerous. The rooms havent a good smell . The breakfast are poor with bad attendance. Our stay was finished of thi form .With total lack of alternatives of lodging in the city for occasion of a fashion fair, asks for plus a daily one, when the hotel surprising informed that we would have that to pay more 300%, believe, of the pay in the previous night or either of 160 euros, we would have that to pay to 500 euros, characterizing one total lack of respect to the guest and the opportunist position of this hotel. If you not to want to have ackward surprises make distance of this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: buxton2006
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance of Catalunya Sq and Rambles, close to metro and bus stops.This hotel came recommended to us. Lovely buffett breakfast, (check when booking if included). I must warn you though if you are staying longer than a weekend ask for a room with an external window as they also have rooms with internal windows facing the lifts, these are dark and quite small.We asked to swap as we were there for a week, had to wait until the following day but staff were helpful and happy to do so. Rooms very clean, spotless bathrooms, comfortable bed.Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, close to Ramblas.”
Reviews.Author: milajayne
Reviews.Content: Hotel 2 minutes walk from Universitat metro and 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. It is in a quiet safe area. The hotel itself was with very 'hotel' standard rooms, very new with a powerful shower and lovely sheets on the beds! I felt it was good value for money and would perhaps stay there again. Staff helpful and excellent breakfast. My only complaints were that the beds were twins pushed together to make a double - easy to fall down the middle! Also our ground floor 'balcony' looked more like somewhere you would put your bins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, position, room,staff and breakfast...GREAT”
Reviews.Author: wudz
Reviews.Content: What great value for money, we stayed for three nights on May14 onward and found the locality to be excellent for a walk to all the central sites. The staff were great, the rooms were spotless as was all the hotel. Breakfast was buffet and more than expected and better than we have had in more expensive hotels. We stayed on the fifth floor with a small balcony overlooking the tree lined road.The hotel also boasts a central opening with a glass domed roof for the two lifts, really bright and open. If you require a central hotel with room air conditioning, safe, TV, mini bar and clean....then your stay here will fill the bill. Expect to pay between 30 and 35 Euros for the taxi from the airport. The city is fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gran Ronda, ok, but......”
Reviews.Author: Sarpe
Reviews.Content: The pictures and the website of the hotel are a little misleading. I was disapointed as I imagined this to be part of a nice chain of hotels......The good points: the hotel is 2 min walk from Plaza Universitat (metro), just in front of a bus stop and 10 min walk from Rambla. The bathroom was very clean, spacious, the bed was comfortable and very clean as well. Breakfast was also nice. However.....the bad points: The room itself was really really tiny. The common areas of the hotel are really dodgy. The reception area looks bad and the receptionists were nice, but not that helpful. Overall it was an OK experience for a couple of nights at a reasonable price, but I will try and find another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,beware of rooms facing the inside!”
Reviews.Author: oneyear
Reviews.Content: Ok this is a hard one for me...We went there for a weekend and we chose it after reading all these good reviews at TA.I'll try and be objective - you'll what I mean. The location is great!Couldn't have been better!We walked everywhere,it is very central and its safe to walk around it at night. Staff where so and so.They were nice but didn't really care when we comlained.We had a problem with our sink the first night.It was full of water and we couldn't wash ourselves so I called reception and the guy said he is on his own so can't do anything but will try to get someone..Went down a bit later to talk to him to complain about our room and in the end he said to me: Do you still want me to call someone to fix the sink?..... The fixed it within an hour! The room...every floor has 2 rooms that have a window facing the elevators and the foayer.They are tiny (I personally dont mind that..) and they have LOADS of noice.Whatever happens downstairs you hear!Impossible to sleep...No daylight coming in...However, it was a nice room,comfortable bed,very clean and nice bathroom. All in all would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you go for the better rooms!I think its a disgrace that they charge them the same and we did compain about it.Unfortunately it was fully booked and they couldn't move us. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to the Apsis Gran Ronda”
Reviews.Author: Mandy W
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Apsis Gran Ronda. We really liked it. The room was comfortable, clean and had all the necessary amenities, TV, safe, minibar. The breakfast, which was included in our rate, was more than adequate to set you up for a days sightseeing. It was a 5-10 minute walk away from Ramblas and Pl Catalunya. Less than 5 minutes from Pl Universitat where you can get off the aerobus and where there is a metro station. We thought it was in an excellent position and will definitely return. A lot of people have commented about personal safety in Barcelona. We did not feel unsafe anywhere. We visited a lot of areas, used the Metro and spent a lot of time walking around and didn't feel concerned about our safety once. Like any large city anywhere in the world you just have to be sensible about flashing your cash or valuables around but other than that it is certainly not the den of theives and pickpockets that some would lead you to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apart from one irritation”
Reviews.Author: Brillo51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located, just a few minutes walk from the University and quite close to La Rambla. Our room had a balcony overlooking the street but, with the doors closed, it was quiet. Big room, very clean, fresh towels daily, good maid service and efficient air-conditioning. Buffet breakfast was fine and there is free internet access in the foyer. The only irritation was the keycard system - each day, after the 12.00 checkout deadline, the cards stopped working, even though we were staying for six nights. As we were on the fifth floor this was more than a little annoying as it meant going back to reception to queue again and get the cards re-programmed, after the third occasion we had the cards re-programmed on entry. The reception staff offered a range of excuses but seemed to accept the problem as 'normal'.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mistress_Yorkie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a long weekend - had heard a lot of bad press about Barcelona with regards to street crime / bag snatching etc, so were keen on this hotel after reading other people mention its nice safe location in their reviews. The street itself is pretty busy and well lit and no more than a 10min walk / drunken stagger from La Rambla with all its nightspots so we were very pleased. Is central for all other touristy destinations, most of which are walkable, and is right in the middle of 2 metro stops which was handy for venturing further afield. Room was fine - clean and beds were comfy, only negative comment was that on 2nd day there was a definite drain smell in the bathroom unfortunately. Didn't bother with 12 euro breakfast, zillions of patisseries en route to wherever you're heading in the morning which were lots cheaper and very tasty! This isn't a luxury hotel, but it looks smart, was in a great location and was ideal for our trip so wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel , small draw back”
Reviews.Author: mogga5
Reviews.Content: hotel good, breakfast very good, rooma very clean, but do not leave items in locked downstairs cupboards after vacating your room. some items were takin from this supposibly secure cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Hotel in Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: philipo49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Ronda from the 15th - 19th Oct '06 and found this a great hotel to stay in. The location is great, 5 minutes walk from Cataluna Square and on a very safe, tree lined street that never once made us feel unsafe even late at night. The hotel itself is ultra modern that looks like it is brand new from the interior. It has very stylish decor, glass fronted lifts that overlook the reception and very sleek looking corridors and rooms. There are smart glass doors throughout the hotel and LCD TVs in reception and every room. The receptionists were spoke superb English and were always very helpful. The only thing stopping me from giving this hotel 5/5 is the size of our room which was very very small! The bathroom was a good size and again very modern but the room itself was tiny, infact the smallest we have ever stayed in. This however did not spoil our holiday as we only used it to shower and sleep in! One other small gripe was the price of the breakfast (which was not included in our stay). It was 11 Euros each which we thought was a bit pricey so we never actually ate there, so I can't comment on the quality. Overall though, this is a great hotel to stay in, excellent interior and brilliant location so I would definately recommend it to anyone planning to visit this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: goldenhippie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Room may seem small but was fine for our purpose. Best nights sleep in a long time. Must find out where they bought their mattresses. Rooms cleaned every day & fresh towels daily very much appreciated. Very convenient location, just short walk to La Rambla. Only downside - don't eat breakfast too late if you want bacon & egg otherwise food fine. Also don't venture too far down the street, away from university area as it appears to be a bit of a red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a Three Star!”
Reviews.Author: GMG74
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Gran Ronda. The room was of a decent size and seemed like it had recently been refurbished. The bathrrom was a wet room style and very spacious. We had requested a room with a balcony which we got and faced on to the main road Ronda San Antonio. We thought it would be noisy as it was a very busy street but once the balcony doors were shut you literally didn't hear a thing. On arrival the room was very clean and we got fresh linen and toels every day. There was also a really good air conditioning unit in the room with controls. A short five minute walk was all it took to get to the middle of La Rambla and there was a metro station two hundred yards from the hotel (Universitat). We didn't choose the breakfast option but it was available for a supplement. All round excellent value for money and would definately return.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gran Ronda
